con:interface.name: Customer Profile Management Microservice
con:interface.con:description:
The profile management microservice enables access to customer data to add, update, retrieve or remove customer profiles.
Design Reference - [Customer Profile Management Microservice](https://drive.google.com/file/d/sampleurl/view?usp=sharing)
## Profile management microservice has the following functions: - Register a new customer - Search customers by name - Get customer profile by Id - Update customer profile - Delete customer
## How the API search logic works? 1. User submits a request to search customer profiles by name 2. Request gets received and customer data is searched in AWS CloudSearch 3. The search result returned has a summary list of customers matching the search criteria
`NOTE: the above search is meant to be used to support predictive search feature at the front-end app`
## How the API search by Id logic works? 1. User submits a request to search customer profiles by name 2. Request gets received and customer data is searched in AWS DynamoDB 3. The search result returned has the complete profile of the customer with all the attributes

con:part.con:content:
--- swagger: "2.0" info: description: "
The profile management microservice enables access to customer data\ \ to add, update, retrieve or remove customer profiles. 

Design Reference -\ \ [Customer Profile Management Microservice](https://drive.google.com/file/d/sampleurl/view?usp=sharing)
\ 
## Profile management microservice has the following functions:
- Register\ \ a new customer
- Search customers by name
- Get customer profile by Id
-\ \ Update customer profile
- Delete customer

## How the API search logic works?
\ 1. User submits a request to search customer profiles by name
2. Request gets\ \ received and customer data is searched in AWS CloudSearch 
3. The search result\ \ returned has a summary list of customers matching the search criteria

`NOTE:\ \ the above search is meant to be used to support predictive search feature at\ \ the front-end app`

## How the API search by Id logic works?
1. User submits\ \ a request to search customer profiles by name
2. Request gets received and\ \ customer data is searched in AWS DynamoDB 
3. The search result returned has\ \ the complete profile of the customer with all the attributes
" version: "1.0.0" title: "Customer Profile Management Microservice" contact: name: "API Support" url: "http://www.example.com/support" email: "info@earth2.com.au" license: name: "MIT License" url: "https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT" host: "api-ecs-dev.myprototype.com.au" tags: - name: "01 Profile Queries (Read)" description: "Operations available to query customer profile" schemes: - "https" paths: /v1/customers: get: tags: - "01 Profile Queries (Read)" summary: "searches customers and return a list" description: "This API returns a summary list of customers who matches the query\ \ parameters (name, dob, etc.) from CloudSearch
" operationId: "searchCustomers" produces: - "application/json" parameters: - name: "Authorization" in: "header" description: "Authorization Header" required: true type: "string" default: "Basic QUtJQUo1WloyNldXR1hWVjNPT0E6Y0FZTXV3T0YrK3NYTDdrc20vTG5YYUNFU1dJVGE4TXpBQXpiaEdiOQ==" - name: "name" in: "query" description: "pass an optional search string for looking up inventory" required: true type: "string" default: "jack" responses: 200: description: "search results matching criteria" schema: type: "array" items: $ref: "#/definitions/customerList" 401: description: "Unauthorized" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 403: description: "Forbidden" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 404: description: "NotFound" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 501: description: "Not Implemented" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 502: description: "Gateway Timeout" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 503: description: "Service Unavailable" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 504: description: "Gateway Timeout" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 505: description: "HTTP Version Not Supported" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" default: description: "Internal Server Error" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" /v1/customers/{customerId}: get: tags: - "01 Profile Queries (Read)" summary: "Get customer profile by id" description: "This API returns the API Profile for the customer with the customer\ \ Id specified by customerId from DynamoDB
" operationId: "getCustomerProfile" produces: - "application/json" parameters: - name: "Authorization" in: "header" description: "Authorization Header" required: true type: "string" default: "Basic QUtJQUo1WloyNldXR1hWVjNPT0E6Y0FZTXV3T0YrK3NYTDdrc20vTG5YYUNFU1dJVGE4TXpBQXpiaEdiOQ==" - name: "customerId" in: "path" description: "Numeric ID of the customer to get." required: true type: "integer" default: 120000040 responses: 200: description: "search results matching criteria" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/customerProfile" 401: description: "Unauthorized" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 403: description: "Forbidden" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 404: description: "NotFound" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 501: description: "Not Implemented" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 502: description: "Gateway Timeout" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 503: description: "Service Unavailable" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 504: description: "Gateway Timeout" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 505: description: "HTTP Version Not Supported" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" default: description: "Internal Server Error" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" definitions: Error: type: "object" required: - "code" - "message" - "status" properties: status: type: "string" example: "OK" description: "application-specific error code" code: type: "string" example: "1010" description: "application-specific error code" message: type: "string" example: "human-readable summary of the problem" description: "human-readable summary of the problem" customerProfile: type: "object" required: - "id" properties: id: type: "string" example: "120001415" name: type: "string" example: "harold jack" firstname: type: "string" example: "jack" lastname: type: "string" example: "jack" dateofbirth: type: "string" example: "1981-11-29" singlelineaddress: type: "string" example: "201 40 46 Shoreline Drive" example: dateofbirth: "1981-11-29" firstname: "jack" name: "harold jack" id: "120001415" singlelineaddress: "201 40 46 Shoreline Drive" lastname: "jack" customerList: required: - "firstname" - "id" - "lastname" - "name" properties: id: type: "string" example: "120001415" name: type: "string" example: "harold jack" firstname: type: "string" example: "jack" lastname: type: "string" example: "jack" dateofbirth: type: "string" example: "1981-11-29" singlelineaddress: type: "string" example: "201 40 46 Shoreline Drive" example: dateofbirth: "1981-11-29" firstname: "jack" name: "harold jack" id: "120001415" singlelineaddress: "201 40 46 Shoreline Drive" lastname: "jack" responses: 400: description: "Bad Request" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 401: description: "Unauthorized" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 403: description: "Forbidden" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 404: description: "NotFound" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 501: description: "Not Implemented" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 502: description: "Bad Gateway" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 503: description: "Service Unavailable" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 504: description: "Gateway Timeout" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" 505: description: "HTTP Version Not Supported" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error" default: description: "Internal Server Error" schema: $ref: "#/definitions/Error"

con:parameter.con:name: customerId
con:parameter.con:description: Numeric ID of the customer to get.

con:method.name: getCustomerProfile
con:method.con:description:
This API returns the API Profile for the customer with the customer Id specified by customerId from DynamoDB
Get customer profile by id

con:method.name: searchCustomers
con:method.con:description:
This API returns a summary list of customers who matches the query parameters (name, dob, etc.) from CloudSearch
searches customers and return a list

con:parameter.con:name: name
con:parameter.con:description: pass an optional search string for looking up inventory
